Name: Modern scarab with the name of king Tuthmosis III
Description: Large glazed steatite scarab, with a fragment from a mummy bandage fastened to the back. Many modern imitations are covered in shreds of cloth, sometimes ancient, to lend an air of authenticity. The underside of the scarab bears a text in garbled hieroglyphs including the throne-name of Tuthmosis III. The forms of the incised signs and the combinations are typical of modern imitations. This example is important, as the date of acquisition indicates a relatively early modern date, in the 1840s.
